alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:14PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ASCENSION, SOUTHEASTERN WEST BATON ROUGE, WESTERN ST. TAMMANY, LIVINGSTON, EAST CENTRAL IBERVILLE, SOUTHERN TANGIPAHOA AND SOUTH CENTRAL EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CST... At 1114 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Montpelier to near Village St. George. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Denham Springs, Plaquemine, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Ponchatoula, Walker, Livingston, Independence, French Settlement, Albany, Port Vincent, Folsom, Springfield, Westminster, Watson, Natalbany, Robert, and Shenandoah. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 160 and 174. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 47. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 23 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; West Baton Rouge
